newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: RUGBY UNION-GIBBS TO FACE DISCIPLINARY HEARING.
newsitem.headline: RUGBY UNION-GIBBS TO FACE DISCIPLINARY HEARING.

text.p: British Lions centre Scott Gibbs will appear before a disciplinary committee of the South African Rugby Football Union (SARFU) after being cited for alleged punching a Northern Transvaal player on Saturday.
Gibbs has been accused of striking Northerns centre Grant Esterhuizen shortly after coming on as a replacement in the Lions' 35-30 defeat.
A citing committee reviewed a tape of the incident and decided there was a case to answer after Northern Transvaal cited Gibbs.
He will appear before the SARFU committee on Sunday morning.
The defeat ended the Lions' run of four successive victories in South Africa and coach Ian McGeechan blamed errors for the loss.
"We made far too many mistakes and we had a very casual first half. You can't give a side like Northerns an 11-point start," said McGeechan, who saw his side 11-0 down after 22 minutes.

"We gave away the ball too easily and didn't make them win it. Just when we were getting our momentum in the second half, building our confidence and applying pressure by not giving the ball away, they scored the interception try. It came at a vital time."
The Lions had clawed their way back to 25-20 after trailing 25-7 before Northerns centre Danie van Schalkwyk picked off a pass from Gregor Townsend to score under the posts.
"We never had the ball for any length of time in their half and we made too many mistakes so we never created any attacking opportunities," said captain Martin Johnson.
The Lions next meet Gauteng Lions in Johannesburg on Wednesday.
